fields.label: Title
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's title is {{field:personalinformationTitle}}.

fields.label: First Name(s)
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's first name is {{field:firstName}}.

fields.label: Middle Name(s)
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's middle name is {{field:middleName}}.

fields.label: Last Name
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's last name is {{field:lastName}}.

fields.label: Known As
fields.infoText: Any name the Testator is commonly known by, if different from their legal name
fields.willClauseText: The Testator is also known as {{field:knownAs}}.

fields.label: Alias
fields.infoText: Any other name the Testator uses or is known by
fields.willClauseText: The Testator uses the alias {{field:alias}}.

fields.label: Date of Birth
fields.infoText: Please enter date in format: dd/mm/yyyy
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's date of birth is {{field:dateOfBirth}}.

fields.label: Gender
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's gender is {{field:gender}}.

fields.label: Mobile
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's mobile number is {{field:mobile}}.

fields.label: Tel 2
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's alternative phone number is {{field:tel2}}.

fields.label: Email
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's email address is {{field:email}}.

fields.label: Occupation
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's occupation is {{field:occupation}}.

fields.label: What is the Testator's marital status?
fields.willClauseText: The Testator's marital status is {{field:maritalStatus}}.

fields.label: Is the Testator making this Will in contemplation of marriage or civil partnership?
fields.infoText: Under normal circumstances, a Will is revoked upon marriage/civil partnership. Selecting yes to this question will confirm that the Testator is making this Will in contemplation of marriage or civil partnership which will ensure the Will is not revoked if this event is to occur.

fields.label: Partner
fields.willClauseText: Partner(s): {{field:partnerSection.fullDetails|None specified}}

fields.label: Does the Testator have any property / assets abroad?
Does the Testator hold property within the EU / EEA?
Shall the law of England and Wales govern the succession of foreign assets within the EU / EEA?
fields.infoText: This will include the Brussels IV clause which means any assets within the EU / EEA except the UK, Ireland, and Denmark can be governed as close to the English/Welsh Law as possible.

fields.label: Is the Testator a UK National or a Habitual Resident?
Has the Testator made a foreign Will which should not be revoked?
fields.infoText: A Will by default would revoke all previous Wills. However, if the Testator has made a Will in a foreign country that they wish to keep in place, selecting yes to this question would include a clause to allow this.

fields.label: Is this Will to only apply to England, Wales, and Northern Ireland?

options.value: Yes - England, Wales and Northern Ireland
options.label: Yes - England, Wales and Northern Ireland

fields.label: Where is the foreign Will located?
fields.infoText: We will exclude this from the revocation clause. Leaving this blank will include provision for any country outside of England and Wales
fields.willClauseText: I hereby declare that this Will shall not revoke any Will that I have previously made concerning my assets in {{field:foreignWillLocation}}.

fields.label: Does the Testator wish to appoint Guardians for any minor children?
fields.infoText: If the Testator has care of minors, they may wish to appoint guardians to care for them should they pass away. The other parent of the Testator's children normally has joint parental responsibility for any children aged under 18.

options.value: Yes, but appoint different guardians for children
options.label: Yes, but appoint different guardians for children

value: Yes, but appoint different guardians for children

subFields.text: No guardian has been specified.

fields.label: Who are the substitute guardians? (if any)

subFields.text: No substitute guardian has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Substitute Guardian

fields.label: Who are the Executors?
fields.willClauseText: I appoint {{field:executorsSection:fullDetails}} to be the Executor(s) and Trustee(s) of my estate, with full power to administer my estate according to law and the terms of this Will.

subFields.text: No executor has been specified.

fields.label: Who are the substitute Executors?
fields.willClauseText: If any of my appointed Executors is unable or unwilling to serve, I appoint {{field:substituteExecutorsSection:fullDetails}} to serve as substitute Executor(s) and Trustee(s) with the same powers and responsibilities.

subFields.text: No substitute executor has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Substitute Executor

fields.label: Shall a Professional Executor or Professional Substitute Executors be appointed?
Who shall act as a professional Executor?
fields.infoText: If there are other Executors specified, the professional Executor shall act jointly with any others specified.
fields.willClauseText: I appoint {{field:professionalExecutorSection:fullDetails}} to serve as my professional Executor and Trustee, with full power to administer my estate according to law and the terms of this Will.

subFields.text: No professional executor has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Professional Executor

fields.label: If 'Other', please specify the company and/or individual
Who shall act as substitute professional Executor?
fields.infoText: If there are other substitute Executors specified, the professional Executor shall act jointly with any others specified.
fields.willClauseText: If {{field:professionalExecutorSection:name}} is unable or unwilling to serve as my professional Executor, I appoint {{field:substituteProfessionalExecutorSection:fullDetails}} to serve in their place with the same powers and responsibilities.

subFields.text: No substitute professional executor has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Substitute Professional Executor

fields.label: If 'Other', please specify the company and/or individual
Include professional executor power for remuneration?
Should the Executors be appointed to look after any digital assets / online accounts?
Would you like to appoint separate digital Executors?
Who are the digital Executors?
fields.willClauseText: I appoint {{field:digitalExecutorsSection:fullDetails}} solely for the purpose of dealing with my digital assets, including accessing, managing, and distributing these assets according to my wishes.

subFields.text: No digital executor has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Digital Executor

fields.label: Shall there be different Trustees appointed to the Executors?
Who are the Trustees?
fields.willClauseText: I appoint {{field:trusteesSection:fullDetails}} to serve as the Trustee(s) of all trusts created under this Will, with full power to administer these trusts according to their terms.

subFields.text: No trustee has been specified.

fields.label: Who shall act as substitute Trustees?
fields.willClauseText: If any of my appointed Trustees is unable or unwilling to serve, I appoint {{field:substituteTrusteesSection:fullDetails}} to serve as substitute Trustee(s) with the same powers and responsibilities.

subFields.text: No substitute trustee has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Substitute Trustee

fields.label: Shall a professional Trustee be appointed?
Who are the professional Trustees?
fields.willClauseText: I appoint {{field:professionalTrusteesSection:fullDetails}} to serve as my professional Trustee for all trusts created under this Will, with full power to administer these trusts according to their terms.

subFields.text: No professional trustee has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Professional Trustee

fields.label: Who shall act as substitute professional Trustees?
fields.willClauseText: If {{field:professionalTrusteesSection:name}} is unable or unwilling to serve as my professional Trustee, I appoint {{field:substituteProfessionalTrusteesSection:fullDetails}} to serve in their place with the same powers and responsibilities.

subFields.text: No substitute professional trustee has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Substitute Professional Trustee

fields.label: Include a clause directing that executors shall only act if all in that level reach a certain age
Specify age
fields.willClauseText: My Executors shall only be eligible to act if all appointed Executors in that class have attained the age of {{field:executorSpecifyAge:value}} years at the time of my death.

fields.label: Shall any provisions be included for inability to sign the Will?

options.label: The Testator is able to sign, but their signature may be weak or shaky
The Testator is unable to sign but can make mark
The Testator is unable to read
The Testator is able to read but cannot sign
Yes, the Testator is visually impaired
The Testator is unable to read and cannot sign
The Testator is visually impaired but can sign
The Testator has an imperfect knowledge of the English Language

fields.label: Would the Testator like to make organs available for donation / scientific purposes?
fields.infoText: the Testator's personal representatives (executors) are responsible for the disposal of the Testator's body.

fields.label: Which are the specific organs?
fields.placeholder: Example: eyes, eyes and heart, eyes, heart, and brain

fields.label: Which are the specific organs?
fields.placeholder: Example: eyes, eyes and heart, eyes, heart, and brain

fields.label: What purposes shall organs be made available for?
fields.infoText: Leaving these options empty will assume the Testator wishes to leave organs for any purposes.

fields.label: Does the Testator want to specify any funeral arrangements?
Does the Testator wish to be buried or cremated?
Please state any other requirements
fields.infoText: Please note: It is possible that the Will is not discovered until after funeral plans are made, so it is advisable to create a memorandum of funeral wishes if the Testator has any specific instructions.
fields.willClauseText: Regarding my funeral arrangements, I wish {{field:otherFuneralRequirements:value}}. I request that my Executors take all reasonable steps to honor these wishes.
examples: I wish to be buried in a specific cemetery.
I wish to have a specific type of service.
I wish to have my ashes scattered at a specific location.

fields.label: Does the Testator have any business interests?
Does the Testator wish to grant the trustees power to carry on business?
Does the Testator wish to appoint separate business trustee?
Who are the separate Trustees?
fields.willClauseText: Notwithstanding other appointments in this Will, I appoint {{field:separateTrusteesSection:fullDetails}} to serve solely as Trustee(s) for the purposes of managing my business interests. They shall have full power to make decisions regarding the continuation, management, or sale of these interests.

subFields.text: No separate trustee has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Separate Trustee

fields.label: Include a Business Property Relief Trust?
Business Property Relief Trust
fields.willClauseText: I give such of my business assets as qualify for Business Property Relief from Inheritance Tax to my Trustees to hold on the terms of the Business Property Relief Trust detailed in Schedule {{field:bprTrustScheduleNumber:value}} of this Will.

subFields.label: Business Property Details
subFields.placeholder: Enter details of the business property for the trust

subFields.label: Business Property Relief Trust Terms
subFields.placeholder: Enter the terms of the business property relief trust

fields.label: Does the Testator want to leave any gifts of money?

subFields.label: Enter monetary gift details
subFields.placeholder: Enter the monetary gifts you wish to make (e.g., '10,000 to my nephew Richard Jones')

fields.label: Should any shares of gifts pass to the other beneficiaries proportionately according to their shares should their gift fail (if distributing in shares)?
Does the Testator want to leave any specific gifts?

subFields.label: Enter specific gifts details
subFields.placeholder: Enter the specific gifts you wish to make (e.g., 'My diamond ring to my daughter Jane Smith')

fields.label: Should any shares of gifts pass to the other beneficiaries proportionately according to their shares should their gift fail (if distributing in shares)?
Does the Testator want to leave any gifts of property (not in a property trust)?

subFields.label: Enter property gift details
subFields.placeholder: Enter the property gifts you wish to make (e.g., 'My house at 123 Main St to my son John Smith')

fields.label: Should any shares of gifts pass to the other beneficiaries proportionately according to their shares should their gift fail (if distributing in shares)?

subFields.label: Property Details
subFields.placeholder: Enter the property details for the trust (e.g., '55 Oak Street, London, NW1 6XE')

subFields.label: Property Trust Terms
subFields.placeholder: Enter the terms of the property trust

fields.label: What should happen to personal possessions not specified by this Will?

options.label: Pass on same terms as residue

fields.label: Who should receive the remaining personal possessions?

subFields.text: No recipient has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Chattel Recipient

options.label: IHT to be paid by the estate
IHT to be paid by the recipient

fields.label: Would you like to produce a memorandum of wishes for low value gifts?
Would the Testator like to forgive any debts?
Is the Testator deliberately excluding any person from this Will who may claim against the estate or object to the terms of the will?
Who is the Testator excluding?
fields.infoText: Warning: many specialists believe an exclusion clause can provoke a claim that might not otherwise have been made. If used we recommend the Testator writes a side letter to the Executors, explaining their reasons, that could be used in evidence if necessary.

subFields.text: No excluded person has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Excluded Person

fields.label: Does the Testator wish their spouse to benefit from this Will even if divorce / annulment takes place?
fields.infoText:
Use of this clause should be carefully considered as not all divorces are amicable.

Selecting yes to this question will explicitly exclude Section 18a of the Wills Act 1837.

fields.label: Should any gifts to the Testator's children be stopped from automatically passing to their own children, should the gift fail?
fields.infoText: Selecting yes to this question will explicitly exclude Section 33 of the Wills Act 1837.

fields.label: Funeral Wishes
fields.placeholder: Enter the Testator's funeral wishes (e.g., 'I wish to be cremated and have my ashes scattered at sea')
fields.willClauseText: I request that my Executors take all reasonable steps to honor my funeral wishes as expressed in this Will.

fields.label: Would the Testator like to include provisions for pets?
Who is to care for the Testator's pets?
fields.infoText: Any pets owned by the Testator at the date of their death shall be cared for by named beneficiary.
fields.willClauseText: I request that my {{field:petCarerSection:relationshipList}} {{field:petCarerSection:nameList}} of {{field:petCarerSection:addressList}} care for any pets I own at the time of my death. I trust them to provide a loving home for these animals.

subFields.text: No pet carer has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Pet Carer

fields.label: Who is the substitute carer for the Testator's pets?
fields.willClauseText: If my {{field:petCarerSection:relationshipList}} {{field:petCarerSection:nameList}} is unable or unwilling to care for my pets, I request that my {{field:substitutePetCarerSection:relationshipList}} {{field:substitutePetCarerSection:nameList}} of {{field:substitutePetCarerSection:addressList}} assume this responsibility instead.

subFields.text: No substitute pet carer has been specified.

subFields.label: Enter details for add Substitute Pet Carer

fields.label: Shall any pets be cared for by RSPCA's home for life scheme if unable to be homed?
fields.infoText: The Home for Life Scheme gives the Testator peace of mind that, in the event of their death, the RSPCA will care for your pets and re-home them, if possible. You can apply online here

fields.label: Would the Testator like to leave a gift of money with any pets?
Would the Testator like to name a substitute pet carer?
Amount to leave for pet care
fields.willClauseText: I give the sum of {{field:petCarerGift:formattedAmount}} to whoever accepts responsibility for caring for my pets, to be used exclusively for their upkeep, veterinary care, and general welfare.

fields.label: Does the Testator wish to relieve anyone of debts upon the Testator's death?
Who should be released from their debts?

subFields.text: No debtor has been specified.

fields.label: Include Cy-prs clause?
fields.infoText: If the Testator has made a gift to a charity in their Will this clause will ensure that the gift will not fail if the charity ceases to exist at their death. Instead the gift will be made to another charity with similar charitable aims.

fields.label: Bring into account gifts or loans made to children in lifetime?
Would you like to specify any specific loans / gifts within the Will?
Specify Loans / Gifts
fields.placeholder: I wish to make my Executors aware of...

options.label: All standard and special provisions, and include in Will

fields.label: Should any specific STEP provisions be excluded?
Which STEP provision is to be excluded?
fields.willClauseText: The STEP provisions shall apply subject to the exclusion of provision [UserEnteredText].

fields.label: Which STEP provisions are to be excluded?
fields.willClauseText: The STEP provisions shall apply subject to the exclusion of provisions [UserEnteredText].

fields.label: How shall residue be distributed?
fields.infoText: In this definition, the flexible life interest trust means a fixed life interest trust, followed by a discretionary trust.

options.label: Into a Flexible Life Interest Trust (see helper)

subFields.label: Enter residual gift details
subFields.placeholder: Enter details of how the residuary estate should be distributed (e.g., '50% to my wife Jane Smith, 25% to my son John Smith, 25% to my daughter Sarah Jones')

fields.label: Power to revoke/reduce life interest?
fields.infoText: Without this power the discretionary beneficiaries of the trust can't receive any benefit from it until after the life tenant has died...

fields.label: Do you wish to appoint separate Trustees?

subFields.label: Enter life tenant details
subFields.placeholder: Enter details of the life tenant (e.g., 'My wife Jane Smith')

subFields.label: Enter beneficiaries details
subFields.placeholder: Enter details of the beneficiaries (e.g., 'My children John Smith and Sarah Jones')

fields.label: At the end of the Trust how is it to be distributed?

subFields.label: Enter distribution details
subFields.placeholder: Enter details of how the trust should be distributed at the end (e.g., 'Equally between my children who survive me')

fields.label: Does the Testator wish to specify any further gifts of residue, should the aforementioned gifts fail?

subFields.label: Enter further residual gift details
subFields.placeholder: Enter details of the contingent residuary gifts (e.g., 'To my brother Robert Smith')

fields.label: Should any shares of gifts pass to the other beneficiaries proportionately according to their shares should their gift fail (if distributing in shares)?
Does the Testator wish to give at least 10% of their net estate to charity?
fields.infoText: A charitable gift of 10% or more of your estate will reduce the rate of tax due on the balance from 40% to 36% but will cause your executors much more work and possibly involve complex calculations

fields.label: Shall the gift be made only if inheritance tax is due?
Shall the charitable gift be split in different shares to different charities?

subFields.label: Enter charity details
subFields.placeholder: Enter details of the charities that will benefit (e.g., 'The British Red Cross (Charity No. 220949)')

fields.label: Is there a minimum amount or percentage you wish to leave whether tax relief is available or not?
How shall IHT be dealt with when splitting residue between exempt and non-exempt beneficiaries? (if applicable)

options.label: Division of shares before tax (Ratcliffe - default)

fields.label: How would you describe the Testator's physical health?
Do you have any concerns about the Testator in respect of capacity, confusion or memory loss?
Does the Testator have Testamentary Capacity?
fields.infoText: The test for capacity to execute a valid Will is based in case law...

fields.label: Are you satisfied that the Testator understands that they are giving instructions for their Will?
Are you satisfied that the Testator is aware of who may have a claim on their Estate?
Are there any other people present at the time of taking instruction other than the client?
Are you satisfied that the Testator isn't being unduly influenced by any other person?

fields.infoText: An interpreter will be required as the second witness to read the Will in front of another witness, in both English and the Testator's native language.
